data.enText: moving or able to move quickly

data.chText: 世界最快的赛跑运动员

data.enText: happening in a short time or without delay
data.chText: 迅速发生的；立即发生的

data.enText: the fastest rate of increase for years

data.chText: 动作迅速的；头脑灵活的

data.enText: showing a time later than the true time
I'm early─my watch must be fast.
data.chText: 我早了——我的表肯定快了。

data.enText: very sensitive to light, and therefore useful when taking photographs in poor light or of sth that is moving very quickly
not likely to change or to come out when washed

data.text: There is no noun related to fast . Use speed in connection with vehicles, actions, etc.; quickness is used about thinking.
fast没有派生的名词。关于交通工具、行动等的速度用speed；关于思维则用quickness。

data.enText: full of rapid action and sudden changes
data.chText: 情节节奏快且变化多端

data.enText: In his latest movie, the action is fast and furious.
data.chText: 在他的最新电影中，情节起伏跌宕。

data.enText: a person who can talk very quickly and easily, but who cannot always be trusted
data.chText: 快嘴快舌但不可信赖的人

data.enText: a person who knows how to get what they want quickly, especially when beginning a sexual relationship with sb
data.chText: 善于迅速达到目的的人；（尤指恋爱方面）善于一下子获得青睐的人

data.enText: to earn money quickly and easily
that cannot be changed in any circumstances
There are no hard and fast rules about this.
data.chText: 这事没有什么硬性的规定。

data.enText: in a short time; without delay
Children grow up so fast these days.
Britain is fast becoming a nation of fatties.
data.chText: 英国不久就要变成一个胖子国了。

data.enText: The police said that they had reacted as fast as they could.
data.chText: 警方说他们已尽快作出了反应。

data.enText: Within a few minutes she was fast asleep (= sleeping deeply) .
The boat was stuck fast (= unable to move) in the mud.
data.chText: 船深陷在淤泥里动弹不得。

data.text: There is no noun related to fast . Use speed in connection with vehicles, actions, etc.; quickness is used about thinking.
fast没有派生的名词。关于交通工具、行动等的速度用speed；关于思维则用quickness。

data.enText: as fast as your legs can carry you
to continue to believe in an idea, etc. despite difficulties
to treat sb/sth in a way that shows that you feel no responsibility or respect for them
data.chText: 反复无常；若即若离；玩弄

data.enText: to refuse to move back; to refuse to change your opinions
data.chText: 坚定不移；不让步；不改变主张

data.enText: Questions were coming at them thick and fast.
data.chText: 问题铺天盖地向他们而来。

data.enText: to eat little or no food for a period of time, especially for religious or health reasons

data.chText: 伊斯兰教徒在斋月期间斋戒。

data.enText: a period during which you do not eat food, especially for religious or health reasons
These adjectives are frequently used with the following nouns.
data.chText: 这些形容词常与下列名词连用：

data.enText: Fast is used especially to describe a person or thing that moves or is able to move at great speed.
data.chText: fast尤用以描述高速运动的人或事物。

data.enText: Quick is more often used to describe something that is done in a short time or without delay.
data.chText: quick较常用以描述迅速或立即完成的事。

data.enText: Rapid , swift and speedy are more formal words.
Rapid is most commonly used to describe the speed at which something changes. It is not used to describe the speed at which something moves or is done.
data.chText: rapid最常用于描述事物变化的速度，而非运动或完成的速度：

data.enText: Swift usually describes something that happens or is done quickly and immediately.
data.chText: swift通常用以描述事物发生或完成的速度快而及时：

data.enText: It is used less often to talk about the speed at which something moves.
data.chText: 该词较少用于指事物运动的速度：

data.text: as adverbs, see the usage note at
关于fast和quick作副词的用法，见quick词条的用法说明。

data.enText: Quickly is the usual adverb from quick .
I quickly realized that I was on the wrong train.
data.chText: 我很快意识到我坐错了火车。

data.enText: My heart started to beat more quickly.
Quick is sometimes used as an adverb in very informal language, especially as an exclamation.
data.chText: 在日常用语中，quick有时用作副词，尤作感叹语：

data.enText: Come on! Quick! They’ll see us!
data.chText: 快点吧！快！他们会看见我们的！

data.enText: My heart started to beat much quicker.
The quicker I get you away from here, the better.
data.chText: 我越快送你离开此地越好。

data.enText: Fast is more often used when you are talking about the speed that somebody or something moves at.
data.chText: 指某人或某物移动的速度多用fast：

data.enText: How fast can a cheetah run?
data.chText: 猎豹奔跑的速度有多快？

ex.enText: She took a fast train to Shanghai.

synonyms.bx: 指移动速度快的或能够快速移动的，也可指迅速或立即发生的。

ex.enText: She gave the teacher a quick answer.
ex.chText: 她给了老师一个迅速的回答。
他是一个机灵的男孩子。

ex.enText: The employee is a quick learner.

synonyms.bx: 指持续或耗费时间短的，移动、做事等速度快的，或指人聪明、机敏的。

ex.enText: The company made a rapid profit growth in the last decade.
ex.chText: 这家公司在过去10年间利润快速增长。

ex.enText: Hearing footsteps, the two thieves made a swift exit.
ex.chText: 听到脚步声，那两名小偷飞快地溜走了。

synonyms.bx: 指立即发生或马上做出的；也可指移动速度快的或能够快速移动的，作此义解时只作定语。

data.enText: full of rapid action and sudden changes
data.chText: 情节节奏快且变化多端

data.enText: In his latest movie, the action is fast and furious.
data.chText: 在他的最新电影中，情节起伏跌宕。

data.enText: a person who can talk very quickly and easily, but who cannot always be trusted
data.chText: 快嘴快舌但不可信赖的人

data.enText: a person who knows how to get what they want quickly, especially when beginning a sexual relationship with sb
data.chText: 善于迅速达到目的的人；（尤指恋爱方面）善于一下子获得青睐的人

data.enText: to earn money quickly and easily
that cannot be changed in any circumstances
There are no hard and fast rules about this.
data.chText: 这事没有什么硬性的规定。

data.enText: as fast as your legs can carry you
to continue to believe in an idea, etc. despite difficulties
to treat sb/sth in a way that shows that you feel no responsibility or respect for them
data.chText: 反复无常；若即若离；玩弄

data.enText: to refuse to move back; to refuse to change your opinions
data.chText: 坚定不移；不让步；不改变主张

data.enText: Questions were coming at them thick and fast.
data.chText: 问题铺天盖地向他们而来。

example: Before the medical exam, you must fast

tr: abstain from certain foods, as for religious or medical reasons
(of a photographic lens or emulsion) causing a shortening of exposure time
acting or moving or capable of acting or moving quickly
example: on the fast track in school
the band played a fast fox trot

tr: (used of timepieces) indicating a time ahead of or later than the correct time

example: the post was still firm after being hit by the car
took a flying glance at the book
Congreve draws a debauched aristocratic society
grass courts are faster than clay

tr: quickly or rapidly (often used as a combining form)
example: how fast can he get here?
ran as fast as he could

example.ex: ...fast cars with flashing lights and sirens...
example.tran: 闪着灯、鸣着笛、飞速行驶的车辆

example.ex: Brindley was known as a very, very fast driver...
example.tran: 众所周知，布林德利是个喜欢飞车的人。

example.ex: The party aims to attract votes from the business and professional communities, which want a faster pace of political reform...
example.tran: 该党的目标是吸引商界和专业社群的选票，因为这两个群体都希望加快政治改革的步伐。

example.ex: The only question is how fast the process will be.
example.tran: 唯一的问题是这个过程会有多快。

example.ex: They work terrifically fast...
example.tran: 他们干活极快。

example.ex: It would be nice to go faster and break the world record...
example.tran: 要是能再快一些、打破世界纪录就好了。

example.ex: He thinks they're not adapting fast enough...
example.tran: 他认为他们适应得不够快。

example.ex: Barnes also knows that he is fast running out of time...
example.tran: 巴恩斯也知道他的时间很快就要用完了。

example.ex: How fast were you driving?...
example.tran: 你当时车开得有多快?

example.ex: How fast would the disease develop?
example.tran: 这种病发展得有多快?

value.def: Fast means happening, moving, or doing something at great speed. You also use fast in questions or statements about speed.

example.ex: When you've got a crisis like this you need professional help — fast!...
example.tran: 当你遇到这样的危急情况，就需要专业救援了——要快！

example.ex: We'd appreciate your leaving as fast as possible.
example.tran: 如果您能尽快离开，我们将不胜感激。

example.ex: That would be an astonishingly fast action on the part of the Congress.
example.tran: 那将会是由国会方面采取的迅雷不及掩耳的行动。

value.def: You use fast to say that something happens without any delay.

example.ex: That clock's an hour fast.
example.tran: 那个钟快了一个小时。

value.def: If a watch or clock is fast, it is showing a time that is later than the real time.

example.ex: She climbed the staircase cautiously, holding fast to the rail...
example.tran: 她紧紧地抓着栏杆，小心翼翼地爬楼梯。

example.ex: The tanker is stuck fast on the rocks.
example.tran: 油轮紧卡在礁石中间动弹不得。

value.def: If you hold something fast, you hold it tightly and firmly. If something is stuck fast, it is stuck very firmly and cannot move.

example.ex: We can only try to hold fast to the age-old values of honesty, decency and concern for others...
example.tran: 我们只能努力坚守那些古老的价值观：诚实、正派、关心他人。

example.ex: He told supporters to stand fast over the next few vital days.
example.tran: 他叫支持者在接下来的几个重要日子里站稳立场。

value.def: If you hold fast to a principle or idea, or if you stand fast, you do not change your mind about it, even though people are trying to persuade you to.

example.ex: The fabric was ironed to make the colours fast.
example.tran: 为防止掉色，织物已经过熨烫。

value.def: If colours or dyes are fast, they do not come out of the fabrics they are used on when they get wet.
value.tran: (颜色或染料)不褪色的，不掉色的

example.ex: Life in Detroit no longer satisfied him; he wanted the fast life of California.
example.tran: 他不再满意底特律的生活，想要过加利福尼亚那种刺激快乐的生活。

value.def: A fast way of life is one which involves a lot of enjoyable and expensive or dangerous activities.
value.tran: 骄奢淫逸的;刺激而快乐的

example.ex: I fasted for a day and half and asked God to help me.
example.tran: 我斋戒了一天半，祈求上帝伸出援手。

example.ex: The fast is broken at sunset, traditionally with dates and water.
example.tran: 日落时开斋，按传统会吃椰枣、喝水。

value.def: If you fast, you eat no food for a period of time, usually for either religious or medical reasons, or as a protest.

example.ex: ...the Muslim holy month of fasting and prayer.
example.tran: 穆斯林斋戒和祈祷的圣月

example.ex: When he went upstairs five minutes later, she was fast asleep.
example.tran: 他5分钟后上楼时，她已睡熟。

value.def: Someone who is fast asleep is completely asleep.

example.ex: There have been people who have played fast and loose with the rules.
example.tran: 有人在玩弄这些规则。

value.def: If you say that someone is playing fast and loose, you are expressing disapproval of them for behaving in a deceitful, immoral, or irresponsible way.

example.ex: No doubt someone had pulled a fast one on her over a procedural matter.
example.tran: 无疑有人在程序性问题上骗了她。

value.def: If you say that someone has pulled a fast one on you, you mean that they have cheated or tricked you.

trans: 快速成长；速生；快速发展；快速生长
（小惯性仪器）快速反应；速动；快响应
傅立叶变换；快速傅里叶变换；快速傅立叶变换；快速傅利叶变换；快速傅氏变换
抓紧；坚守；持守；持定；遵守；牢牢抓住
坚守；站立得稳；不让步；站立得住
快速通道；快速晋升之道；迅速成功之路
加速（人；计划）的发展；促进
